intro: Hedychium ziroense, commonly known as the Ziro ginger or Ziro turmeric, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, fragrant yellow flowers. Its leaves are broad and glossy, often reaching several feet in length. The rhizomes of Hedychium ziroense are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other ginger species.
